text: Stanley Falkow, PhD, (24 January, 1934 â€“ 5 May, 2018) was an American microbiologist and a professor of microbiology and immunology at Stanford University School of Medicine.National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases Stanley Falkow, Ph.D. Retrieved on July 4, 2007 He was known for his study of how infectious microbes and host cells interact to cause disease at the molecular level.The Double Helix NFID to Honor Dr. Falkow Retrieved on July 4, 2007 He created molecular Koch's postulates, which have guided the study of the microbial determinants of infectious diseases since the late 1980s.Falkow S (1988). Falkow died on May 5, 2018 at the age of 84 at his home in Portola Valley, California of complications from myelodysplastic syndrome. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2018 deaths Category:American microbiologists Category:Scientists from New York (state) Category:Stanford University faculty Category:People from Albany, New York
